intro: Helipterum monencyanthioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Helipterum monencyanthioides is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions.
